description: The date when the value set version is no longer expected to be used to create new content. This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes Inactive, so this value MUST present on all Inactive value set versions. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Expiration Date.

element.comment: Upon reaching the Expiration Date, the value set Activity Status should be consdiered as inactive. An Inactive value set version may no longer be used to create new content, but it may be used to evaluate content created prior to the Expiration Date.
element.definition: The date when the value set version is no longer expected to be used to create new content. This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes Inactive, so this value MUST present on all Inactive value set versions. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Expiration Date.
element.short: When the value set version should no longer be used

name: expirationDate

element.comment: Upon reaching the Expiration Date, the value set Activity Status should be consdiered as inactive. An Inactive value set version may no longer be used to create new content, but it may be used to evaluate content created prior to the Expiration Date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The date when the value set version is no longer expected to be used to create new content. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Expiration Date.
element.short: When the value set version should no longer be used

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
